full_threads.body:
Hi Keryn, 

Thanks for the Terms and Conditions.
Confirming we have created a new page for Adelaide Terms and Conditions. https://proposal.dressedforsale.com.au/terms-and-conditions-adelaide/

Ok great thanks Heath.

Here is the replacement T's and C's for the insurance section only.

Let me know if you need the whole document again. ( Adelaide only )

RISK, INSURANCE AND TITLE

8.1 The Hirer shall assume all risks and liabilities for and in respect of the Furniture and for injuries to or death of persons and damage to property howsoever arising and whether by negligence or otherwise, from the possession, use, maintenance, repair or storage of the Furniture, and hereby releases the Owner from all claims and actions relating to the same. The Hirer agrees to indemnify the Owner against the cost of repairs to Furniture which is damaged whilst at the Location.

8.2 If the Hirer does not have public liability insurance for the Location, the Hirer shall effect such insurance with an insurer of recognised standing for an amount of not less than $20,000,000 for any one incident and keep such policy current at all times whilst the Furniture is at the Location. The Hirer shall, on demand, produce to the Owner evidence to the Owner's satisfaction that the current insurance premiums have been paid and that the insurance required hereunder is in force.

8.3 The Hirer shall not do any act or thing which might in any way invalidate or prejudice any such insurance.

8.4 The Owner always remains the owner of the Furniture. The Hirer holds the Furniture as bailee only during the Hire Period. The Owner always retains title to the Goods even if the Hirer goes into bankruptcy or liquidation during the Hire Period.

8.5 The Furniture shall be at the Hirers risk from the Commencement.



Keryn Rogers

Business Manager

Hi Keryn,

Thanks for sending this through. I have a couple of questions to clarify:

Website:
  • Which contact us links are not working for you? I had a check and they all seem to be working, but can you please let me know which ones specifically so that we can look into it?
  • Cookies accept, this is more a question for lawyers, but, it's not hugely policed in AU. 
Quote platform:
  • We will try and figure out the postcode side of things. Can you please send through the Terms and Condition changes you want as well in the meantime?

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath

Thank you for making the changes I requested yesterday 😃 .

We’ve come across a few little things I’d like to ask you about.

Website
contact us links don’t seem to be working and I’m not sure if it’s a website thing or our email account. Would you mind checking this from your end?
Cookies accept - is this a mandatory requirement?

Quote platform
The risk protection option, can we have this option hidden based on postcode? The reason I ask this is Adelaide doesn’t want to use risk protection and our Melbourne site does.
This would also need to be applied to the terms and condtions as it would have slightly different wording in the insurance section. Is this possible or would we have to have 2 separate platforms.


Many thanks.


Keryn Rogers
Business Manager
